ISSUE 404.2

Document Status: OCCUPIED BY CAT
City Hall Beat Rhyme Enforcement Luxury Municipal Wear Nap Forecast: Heavy
Banner Story

Intern declares mayoral bid from copier room, vows that every city form will rhyme by Q3

By Poppy Quill, age 22, unpaid but spiritually salaried

At 8:04 AM I stood beside Copier 2B and announced my platform: "If it doesn't rhyme, it doesn't sign." The crowd included two accountants, one fern, and Chairman Marmalade (the cat), who slept directly on permit form CR-11.

The permit could not be retrieved without waking the cat. The cat could not be woken because he is the only public servant polling above 90%. We adapted. We filed a temporary poem instead.

"A city that rhymes together climbs together."

Opinion: Poppy's Column

Why I wear pearl gloves to budget hearings

By Poppy Quill

Luxury is not excess. Luxury is preventing toner dust from touching your knuckles while explaining drainage bonds in iambic pentameter.

Counterpoint: "Cats cannot hold office" is speciesist and uncreative

By Deputy Intern Ronni P.

Marmalade has missed fewer meetings than Councilman Gregg. Also, he sits on documents with conviction.

Guest Essay: My parking ticket made me a better man

By Todd "Double-Parked" Enright

The citation read, "You parked askew, now pay what's due." I paid immediately. I cried respectfully.

Letters to the Editor

"Stop making pothole notices rhyme"

From: E. Barnes, East District

Corrections

In Monday's issue we stated Marmalade slept 14 hours on Form 9C. The correct figure is 16.5 hours.

We described Poppy's campaign coat as "teal." It is officially "Abyssal Mint No. 7."

Yesterday's rhyme hotline number ended in 8181. It ends in 1818. We regret the unrhymed confusion.
